intro: Sarothra quinquenervia, commonly known as the five-veined fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant exhibits a complex venation pattern, with five prominent veins running along the length of each leaf. Sarothra quinquenervia typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce spores in clusters, contributing to its reproductive strategy.
